titleStmt.title: A nights search· Discovering the nature and condition of all sorts of night-walkers; with their associates. As also, the life and death of many of them. Together with divers fearfull and strange accidents, occasioned by such ill livers. Digested into a poeme by Humphry Mill.
Nights search. Part 1.
titleStmt.author: Mill, Humphrey, fl. 1646.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Richard Bishop for Laurence Blaicklock at the Sugar-loafe next Temple-Barre,

notesStmt.note: With an additional title page, engraved.
The first leaf contains an explanation of the engraved title.
A second part was published in 1646.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
